title.narrative: INCLUSIVE AND QUALITY EDUCATION.

description.narrative: Low-achievement schools address violence and promote participatory, inclusive and quality education., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Adolescent Empowerment, Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Evaluation And Research, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning Outcomes, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Reducing Child Poverty, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, particularly those in situations of disadvantage, benefit from coordinated policies and programmes, have increased access to integrated social services, and have their rights increasingly monitored.

sector.narrative: System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - mainstreaming of skills development within national education/training system
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support
Upper Secondary Education (modified and includes data from 11322)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Low-achievement schools address violence and promote participatory, inclusive and quality education.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued supporting the Government for school´s reopening, addressing disparities in access to schools and preschools, and improving equity in remote education. As part of this process, UNICEF supported dialogue amongst civil society actors and monitoring school reopening processes at preschool level. UNICEF raised awareness about the difficulties that children with disabilities faced during the school closures and is currently working on policies and services bottlenecks in the school system for children with disabilities. During 2021, UNICEF continued working to end violence in schools and for advancing children´s right to education under the new Constitution.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: % of schools with school development plans in place that explicitly address equity issues.(55271), Text

baseline.value: There is no low achievement schools with articulated and sustained strategies to ensure effective inclusion and integral aspect of learning process.

target.value: 2022: Authorities of the Ministry of Education have a map of critical nodes and proposals to advance the educational inclusion of children and adolescents with special educational needs

actual.value: 2021:Technical teams from the public sector in education incorporate relevant content to advance in the installation of an inclusive education approach in their practices and in the design of strategies for working with schools, specifically in the areas of sc
